name: St. Odo of Cluny
summary: Odo of Cluny was the second abbot of Cluny and a key figure in the Cluniac Reforms. He expanded the influence of Cluny Abbey and reformed monasteries throughout France and Italy. He was known for his strict adherence to the Rule of St. Benedict and his efforts to reform the clergy. His reforms helped establish Cluny as one of the most important monastic centers in medieval Europe.
